cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of recognizing words in natural images, which is a common task in computer vision (cs.CV). The proposed method involves the use of a convolutional neural network (CNN) and a Conditional Random Field (CRF) graphical model, which are both commonly used in natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as text recognition (cs.CL) and language modelling (cs.IR). The paper also mentions the use of multi-task learning, which is a popular technique in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Overall, the paper's focus on combining computer vision and natural language processing techniques suggests that it is most likely to belong to the cs.CV and cs.CL sub-categories, but it also touches on topics related to machine learning, information retrieval, and artificial intelligence.
